00070 struct content_entry {
00071     ccnr_accession accession;   /**< permanent repository id */
00072     ccnr_cookie cookie;         /**< for in-memory references */
00073     int flags;                  /**< see below - use accessor functions */
00074     int size;                   /**< size of ContentObject */
00075     struct ccn_charbuf *flatname; /**< for skiplist, et. al. */
00076     struct ccn_charbuf *cob;    /**< may contain ContentObject, or be NULL */
00077 };

00091 #define FAILIF(cond) do {} while ((cond) && r_store_fatal(h, __func__, __LINE__))
00092 #define CHKSYS(res) FAILIF((res) == -1)
00093 #define CHKRES(res) FAILIF((res) < 0)
00094 #define CHKPTR(p)   FAILIF((p) == NULL)

00096 static int
00097 r_store_fatal(struct ccnr_handle *h, const char *fn, int lineno)
00098 {
00099     if (h != NULL) {
00100         ccnr_msg(h,
00101                  "fatal error in %s, line %d, errno %d%s",
00102                  fn, lineno, errno, strerror(errno));
00103     }
00104     abort();
00105     return(0);
00106 }

00126 static off_t
00127 r_store_offset_from_accession(struct ccnr_handle *h, ccnr_accession a)
00128 {
00129     return(a & ((((ccnr_accession)1) << 48) - 1));

00132 static unsigned
00133 r_store_repofile_from_accession(struct ccnr_handle *h, ccnr_accession a)
00134 {
00135     /* Initially this should always be 1 */
00136     return(a >> 48);

00146 static const unsigned char *
00147 r_store_content_read(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00148 {
00149     unsigned repofile;
00150     off_t offset;
00151     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = NULL;
00152     ssize_t rres = 0;
00153     int fd = -1;
00154     unsigned char buf[8800];
00155     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder decoder = {0};
00156     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder *d = &decoder;
00157     ssize_t dres;
00158     
00159     repofile = r_store_repofile_from_accession(h, content->accession);
00160     offset = r_store_offset_from_accession(h, content->accession);
00161     if (repofile != 1)
00162         goto Bail;
00163     if (content->cob != NULL)
00164         goto Bail;
00165     fd = r_io_repo_data_file_fd(h, repofile, 0);
00166     if (fd == -1)
00167         goto Bail;
00168     cob = ccn_charbuf_create_n(content->size);
00169     if (cob == NULL)
00170         goto Bail;
00171     if (content->size > 0) {
00172         rres = pread(fd, cob->buf, content->size, offset);
00173         if (rres == content->size) {
00174             cob->length = content->size;
00175             content->cob = cob;
00176             h->cob_count++;
00177             return(cob->buf);
00178         }
00179         if (rres == -1)
00180             ccnr_msg(h, "r_store_content_read %u :%s (errno = %d)",
00181                      fd, strerror(errno), errno);
00182         else
00183             ccnr_msg(h, "r_store_content_read %u expected %d bytes, but got %d",
00184                      fd, (int)content->size, (int)rres);
00185     } else {
00186         rres = pread(fd, buf, 8800, offset); // XXX - should be symbolic
00187         if (rres == -1) {
00188             ccnr_msg(h, "r_store_content_read %u :%s (errno = %d)",
00189                      fd, strerror(errno), errno);
00190             goto Bail;
00191         }
00192         dres = ccn_skeleton_decode(d, buf, rres);
00193         if (d->state != 0) {
00194             ccnr_msg(h, "r_store_content_read %u : error parsing cob", fd);
00195             goto Bail;
00196         }
00197         content->size = dres;
00198         if (ccn_charbuf_append(cob, buf, dres) < 0)
00199             goto Bail;
00200         content->cob = cob;
00201         h->cob_count++;
00202         return(cob->buf);        
00203     }
00204 Bail:
00205     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00206     return(NULL);
00207 }
00208 
00209 /**
00210  *  If the content appears to be safely stored in the repository,
00211  *  removes any buffered copy.
00212  * @returns 0 if buffer was removed, -1 if not.
00213  */
00214 PUBLIC int
00215 r_store_content_trim(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00216 {
00217     if (content->accession != CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION && content->cob != NULL) {
00218         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&content->cob);
00219         h->cob_count--;
00220         return(0);
00221     }
00222     return(-1);
00223 }
00224 
00225 /**
00226  *  Evict recoverable content from in-memory buffers
00227  */
00228 PUBLIC void
00229 r_store_trim(struct ccnr_handle *h, unsigned long limit)
00230 {
00231     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00232     int checklimit;
00233     unsigned before;
00234     unsigned rover;
00235     unsigned mask;
00236     
00237     r_store_index_needs_cleaning(h);
00238     before = h->cob_count;
00239     if (before <= limit)
00240         return;
00241     checklimit = h->cookie_limit;
00242     mask = h->cookie_limit - 1;
00243     for (rover = (h->trim_rover & mask);
00244          checklimit > 0 && h->cob_count > limit;
00245          checklimit--, rover = (rover + 1) & mask) {
00246         content = h->content_by_cookie[rover];
00247         if (content != NULL)
00248             r_store_content_trim(h, content);
00249     }
00250     h->trim_rover = rover;
00251     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdf, CCNL_FINER))
00252         ccnr_msg(h, "trimmed %u cobs", before - h->cob_count);
00253 }
00254 
00255 /**
00256  *  Get the base address of the content object
00257  *
00258  * This may involve reading the object in.  Caller should not assume that
00259  * the address will stay valid after it relinquishes control, either by
00260  * returning or by calling routines that might invalidate objects.
00261  *
00262  */
00263 PUBLIC const unsigned char *
00264 r_store_content_base(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00265 {
00266     const unsigned char *ans = NULL;
00267     
00268     if (content->cob != NULL && content->cob->length == content->size) {
00269         ans = content->cob->buf;
00270         goto Finish;
00271     }
00272     if (content->accession == CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION)
00273         goto Finish;
00274     ans = r_store_content_mapped(h, content);
00275     if (ans != NULL)
00276         goto Finish;
00277     ans = r_store_content_read(h, content);
00278 Finish:
00279     if (ans != NULL) {
00280         /* Sanity check - make sure first 2 and last 2 bytes are good */
00281         if (content->size < 5 || ans[0] != 0x04 || ans[1] != 0x82 ||
00282             ans[content->size - 1] != 0 || ans[content->size - 2] != 0) {
00283             bogon = ans; /* for debugger */
00284             ans = NULL;
00285         }
00286     }
00287     if (ans == NULL || CCNSHOULDLOG(h, xxxx, CCNL_FINEST))
00288         ccnr_msg(h, "r_store_content_base.%d returning %p (acc=0x%jx, cookie=%u)",
00289                  __LINE__,
00290                  ans,
00291                  ccnr_accession_encode(h, content->accession),
00292                  (unsigned)content->cookie);
00293     return(ans);
00294 }

00317 PUBLIC int
00318 r_store_content_change_flags(struct content_entry *content, int set, int clear)
00319 {
00320     int old = content->flags;
00321     content->flags |= set;
00322     content->flags &= ~clear;
00323     return(old);
00324 }

00326 /**
00327  * Write a file named index/stable that contains the size of
00328  * repoFile1 when the repository is shut down.
00329  */
00330 static int
00331 r_store_write_stable_point(struct ccnr_handle *h)
00332 {
00333     struct ccn_charbuf *path = NULL;
00334     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = NULL;
00335     int fd, res;
00336     
00337     path = ccn_charbuf_create();
00338     cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00339     if (path == NULL || cb == NULL) {
00340         ccnr_msg(h, "memory allocation failure writing stable mark");
00341         goto Bail;
00342     }
00343     ccn_charbuf_putf(path, "%s/index/stable", h->directory);
00344     unlink(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path)); /* Should not exist, but just in case. */
00345     fd = open(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path),
00346               O_CREAT | O_EXCL | O_WRONLY | O_TRUNC, 0666);
00347     if (fd == -1) {
00348         ccnr_msg(h, "cannot write stable mark %s: %s",
00349                  ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), strerror(errno));
00350         unlink(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path));
00351     }
00352     else {
00353         ccn_charbuf_putf(cb, "%ju", (uintmax_t)(h->stable));
00354         res = write(fd, cb->buf, cb->length);
00355         close(fd);
00356         if (res != cb->length) {
00357             unlink(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path));
00358             ccnr_msg(h, "cannot write stable mark %s: unexpected write result %d",
00359                      ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), res);
00360         }
00361         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, dfsdf, CCNL_INFO))
00362             ccnr_msg(h, "Index marked stable - %s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb));
00363     }
00364 Bail:
00365     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&path);
00366     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00367     return(0);
00368 }
00369 
00370 /**
00371  * Read the former size of repoFile1 from index/stable, and remove
00372  * the latter.
00373  */
00374 static void
00375 r_store_read_stable_point(struct ccnr_handle *h)
00376 {
00377     struct ccn_charbuf *path = NULL;
00378     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = NULL;
00379     int fd;
00380     int i;
00381     ssize_t rres;
00382     uintmax_t val;
00383     unsigned char c;
00384     
00385     path = ccn_charbuf_create();
00386     cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00387     ccn_charbuf_putf(path, "%s/index/stable", h->directory);
00388     fd = open(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), O_RDONLY, 0666);
00389     if (fd != -1) {
00390         rres = read(fd, ccn_charbuf_reserve(cb, 80), 80);
00391         if (rres > 0)
00392             cb->length = rres;
00393         close(fd);
00394         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, dfsdf, CCNL_INFO))
00395             ccnr_msg(h, "Last stable at %s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb));
00396     }
00397     for (val = 0, i = 0; i < cb->length; i++) {
00398         c = cb->buf[i];
00399         if ('0' <= c && c <= '9')
00400             val = val * 10 + (c - '0');
00401         else
00402             break;
00403     }
00404     if (i == 0 || i < cb->length) {
00405         ccnr_msg(h, "Bad stable mark - %s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb));
00406         h->stable = 0;
00407     }
00408     else {
00409         h->stable = val;
00410         unlink(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path));
00411     }
00412     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&path);
00413     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00414 }
00415 
00416 /**
00417  * Log a bit if we are taking a while to re-index.
00418  */
00419 static int
00420 r_store_reindexing(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
00421                    void *clienth,
00422                    struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
00423                    int flags)
00424 {
00425     struct ccnr_handle *h = clienth;
00426     struct fdholder *in = NULL;
00427     unsigned pct;
00428     
00429     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0)
00430         return(0);
00431     in = r_io_fdholder_from_fd(h, h->active_in_fd);
00432     if (in == NULL)
00433         return(0);
00434     pct = ccnr_meter_total(in->meter[FM_BYTI]) / ((h->startupbytes / 100) + 1);
00435     if (pct >= 100)
00436         return(0);
00437     ccnr_msg(h, "indexing %u%% complete", pct);
00438     return(2000000);
00439 }
00440 
00441 /**
00442  * Select power of 2 between l and m + 1 (if possible).
00443  */
00444 static unsigned
00445 choose_limit(unsigned l, unsigned m)
00446 {
00447     unsigned k;
00448     
00449     for (k = 0; k < l; k = 2 * k + 1)
00450         continue;
00451     while (k > (m | 1) || k + 1 < k)
00452         k >>= 1;
00453     return(k + 1);
00454 }
00455 
00456 static void
00457 cleanup_content_entry(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00458 {
00459     unsigned i;
00460     
00461     if ((content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE) != 0)
00462         h->n_stale--;
00463     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_4, CCNL_FINER))
00464         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "remove", NULL, content);
00465     /* Remove the cookie reference */
00466     i = content->cookie & (h->cookie_limit - 1);
00467     if (h->content_by_cookie[i] == content)
00468         h->content_by_cookie[i] = NULL;
00469     content->cookie = 0;
00470     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&content->flatname);
00471     if (content->cob != NULL) {
00472         h->cob_count--;
00473         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&content->cob);
00474     }
00475     free(content);    
00476 }
00477 static void
00478 finalize_accession(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
00479 {
00480     struct ccnr_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(e->ht, NULL);
00481     struct content_by_accession_entry *entry = e->data;
00482     
00483     cleanup_content_entry(h, entry->content);
00484 }
00485 
00486 PUBLIC void
00487 r_store_init(struct ccnr_handle *h)
00488 {
00489     struct ccn_btree *btree = NULL;
00490     struct ccn_btree_node *node = NULL;
00491     struct hashtb_param param = {0};
00492     int i;
00493     int j;
00494     int res;
00495     struct ccn_charbuf *path = NULL;
00496     struct ccn_charbuf *msgs = NULL;
00497     off_t offset;
00498     
00499     path = ccn_charbuf_create();
00500     param.finalize_data = h;
00501     param.finalize = &finalize_accession;
00502     
00503     h->cob_limit = r_init_confval(h, "CCNR_CONTENT_CACHE", 16, 2000000, 4201);
00504     h->cookie_limit = choose_limit(h->cob_limit, (ccnr_cookie)(~0U));
00505     h->content_by_cookie = calloc(h->cookie_limit, sizeof(h->content_by_cookie[0]));
00506     CHKPTR(h->content_by_cookie);
00507     h->content_by_accession_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct content_by_accession_entry), &param);
00508     CHKPTR(h->content_by_accession_tab);
00509     h->btree = btree = ccn_btree_create();
00510     CHKPTR(btree);
00511     FAILIF(btree->nextnodeid != 1);
00512     ccn_charbuf_putf(path, "%s/index", h->directory);
00513     res = mkdir(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), 0700);
00514     if (res != 0 && errno != EEXIST)
00515         r_init_fail(h, __LINE__, ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), errno);
00516     else {
00517         msgs = ccn_charbuf_create();
00518         btree->io = ccn_btree_io_from_directory(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), msgs);
00519         if (btree->io == NULL)
00520             res = errno;
00521         if (msgs->length != 0 && CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sffdsdf, CCNL_WARNING)) {
00522             ccnr_msg(h, "while initializing %s - %s",
00523                      ccn_charbuf_as_string(path),
00524                      ccn_charbuf_as_string(msgs));
00525         }
00526         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&msgs);
00527         if (btree->io == NULL)
00528             r_init_fail(h, __LINE__, ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), res);
00529     }
00530     node = ccn_btree_getnode(btree, 1, 0);
00531     if (btree->io != NULL)
00532         btree->nextnodeid = btree->io->maxnodeid + 1;
00533     CHKPTR(node);
00534     if (node->buf->length == 0) {
00535         res = ccn_btree_init_node(node, 0, 'R', 0);
00536         CHKSYS(res);
00537     }
00538     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&path);
00539     if (h->running == -1)
00540         return;
00541     r_store_read_stable_point(h);
00542     h->active_in_fd = -1;
00543     h->active_out_fd = r_io_open_repo_data_file(h, "repoFile1", 1); /* output */
00544     offset = lseek(h->active_out_fd, 0, SEEK_END);
00545     h->startupbytes = offset;
00546     if (offset != h->stable || node->corrupt != 0) {
00547         ccnr_msg(h, "Index not current - resetting");
00548         ccn_btree_init_node(node, 0, 'R', 0);
00549         node = NULL;
00550         ccn_btree_destroy(&h->btree);
00551         path = ccn_charbuf_create();
00552         /* Remove old index files to avoid confusion */
00553         for (i = 1, j = 0; i > 0 && j < 3; i++) {
00554             path->length = 0;
00555             res = ccn_charbuf_putf(path, "%s/index/%d", h->directory, i);
00556             if (res >= 0)
00557                 res = unlink(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path));
00558             if (res < 0)
00559                 j++;
00560         }
00561         h->btree = btree = ccn_btree_create();
00562         path->length = 0;
00563         ccn_charbuf_putf(path, "%s/index", h->directory);
00564         btree->io = ccn_btree_io_from_directory(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), msgs);
00565         CHKPTR(btree->io);
00566         btree->io->maxnodeid = 0;
00567         btree->nextnodeid = 1;
00568         node = ccn_btree_getnode(btree, 1, 0);
00569         btree->nextnodeid = btree->io->maxnodeid + 1;
00570         ccn_btree_init_node(node, 0, 'R', 0);
00571         h->stable = 0;
00572         h->active_in_fd = r_io_open_repo_data_file(h, "repoFile1", 0); /* input */
00573         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&path);
00574         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, dfds, CCNL_INFO))
00575             ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, 50000, r_store_reindexing, NULL, 0);
00576     }
00577     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, weuyg, CCNL_FINEST)) {
00578         FILE *dumpfile = NULL;
00579         
00580         path = ccn_charbuf_create();
00581         ccn_charbuf_putf(path, "%s/index/btree_check.out", h->directory);
00582         dumpfile = fopen(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), "w");
00583         res = ccn_btree_check(btree, dumpfile);
00584         if (dumpfile != NULL) {
00585             fclose(dumpfile);
00586             dumpfile = NULL;
00587         }
00588         else
00589             path->length = 0;
00590         ccnr_msg(h, "ccn_btree_check returned %d (%s)",
00591                     res, ccn_charbuf_as_string(path));
00592         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&path);
00593         if (res < 0)
00594             r_init_fail(h, __LINE__, "index is corrupt", res);
00595     }
00596     btree->full = r_init_confval(h, "CCNR_BTREE_MAX_FANOUT", 4, 9999, 1999);
00597     btree->full0 = r_init_confval(h, "CCNR_BTREE_MAX_LEAF_ENTRIES", 4, 9999, 1999);
00598     btree->nodebytes = r_init_confval(h, "CCNR_BTREE_MAX_NODE_BYTES", 1024, 8388608, 2097152);
00599     btree->nodepool = r_init_confval(h, "CCNR_BTREE_NODE_POOL", 16, 2000000, 512);
00600     if (h->running != -1)
00601         r_store_index_needs_cleaning(h);
00602 }
00603 
00604 PUBLIC int
00605 r_store_final(struct ccnr_handle *h, int stable) {
00606     int res;
00607     
00608     res = ccn_btree_destroy(&h->btree);
00609     if (res < 0)
00610         ccnr_msg(h, "r_store_final.%d-%d Errors while closing index", __LINE__, res);
00611     if (res >= 0 && stable)
00612         res = r_store_write_stable_point(h);
00613     return(res);
00614 }
00615     
00616 PUBLIC struct content_entry *
00617 r_store_content_from_accession(struct ccnr_handle *h, ccnr_accession accession)
00618 {
00619     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject obj = {0};
00620     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00621     struct content_by_accession_entry *entry;
00622     const unsigned char *content_base = NULL;
00623     int res;
00624     ccnr_accession acc;
00625     
00626     if (accession == CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION)
00627         return(NULL);
00628     entry = hashtb_lookup(h->content_by_accession_tab,
00629                           &accession, sizeof(accession));
00630     if (entry != NULL) {
00631         h->content_from_accession_hits++;
00632         return(entry->content);
00633     }
00634     h->content_from_accession_misses++;
00635     content = calloc(1, sizeof(*content));
00636     CHKPTR(content);
00637     content->cookie = 0;
00638     content->accession = accession;
00639     content->cob = NULL;
00640     content->size = 0;
00641     content_base = r_store_content_base(h, content);
00642     if (content_base == NULL || content->size == 0)
00643         goto Bail;
00644     res = r_store_set_flatname(h, content, &obj);
00645     if (res < 0) goto Bail;
00646     r_store_enroll_content(h, content);
00647     res = r_store_content_btree_insert(h, content, &obj, &acc);
00648     if (res < 0) goto Bail;
00649     if (res == 1 || CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdf, CCNL_FINEST))
00650         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "content/accession", NULL, content);
00651     return(content);
00652 Bail:
00653     ccnr_msg(h, "r_store_content_from_accession.%d failed 0x%jx",
00654              __LINE__, ccnr_accession_encode(h, accession));
00655     r_store_forget_content(h, &content);
00656     return(content);
00657 }
00658 
00659 PUBLIC struct content_entry *
00660 r_store_content_from_cookie(struct ccnr_handle *h, ccnr_cookie cookie)
00661 {
00662     struct content_entry *ans = NULL;
00663     
00664     ans = h->content_by_cookie[cookie & (h->cookie_limit - 1)];
00665     if (ans != NULL && ans->cookie != cookie)
00666         ans = NULL;
00667     return(ans);
00668 }
00669 
00670 /**
00671  * This makes a cookie for content, and, if it has an accession number already,
00672  * enters it into the content_by_accession_tab.  Does not index by name.
00673  */
00674 PUBLIC ccnr_cookie
00675 r_store_enroll_content(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00676 {
00677     ccnr_cookie cookie;
00678     unsigned mask;
00679     
00680     mask = h->cookie_limit - 1;
00681     cookie = ++(h->cookie);
00682     if (cookie == 0)
00683         cookie = ++(h->cookie); /* Cookie numbers may wrap */
00684     // XXX - check for persistence here, if we add that
00685     r_store_forget_content(h, &(h->content_by_cookie[cookie & mask]));
00686     content->cookie = cookie;
00687     h->content_by_cookie[cookie & mask] = content;
00688     if (content->accession != CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION) {
00689         struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00690         struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00691         ccnr_accession accession = content->accession;
00692         struct content_by_accession_entry *entry = NULL;
00693         hashtb_start(h->content_by_accession_tab, e);
00694         hashtb_seek(e, &accession, sizeof(accession), 0);
00695         entry = e->data;
00696         if (entry != NULL)
00697             entry->content = content;
00698         hashtb_end(e);
00699         content->flags |= CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STABLE;
00700     }
00701     return(cookie);
00702 }
00703 
00704 /** @returns 2 if content was added to index, 1 if it was there but had no accession, 0 if it was already there, -1 for error */
00705 static int
00706 r_store_content_btree_insert(struct ccnr_handle *h,
00707                              struct content_entry *content,
00708                              struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco,
00709                              ccnr_accession *accp)
00710 {
00711     const unsigned char *content_base = NULL;
00712     struct ccn_btree *btree = NULL;
00713     struct ccn_btree_node *leaf = NULL;
00714     struct ccn_btree_node *node = NULL;
00715     struct ccn_charbuf *flat = NULL;
00716     int i;
00717     int limit;
00718     int res;
00719 
00720     btree = h->btree;
00721     if (btree == NULL)
00722         return(-1);
00723     flat = content->flatname;
00724     if (flat == NULL)
00725         return(-1);
00726     res = ccn_btree_lookup(h->btree, flat->buf, flat->length, &leaf);
00727     if (res < 0)
00728         return(-1);
00729     i = CCN_BT_SRCH_INDEX(res);
00730     if (CCN_BT_SRCH_FOUND(res)) {
00731         *accp = ccnr_accession_decode(h, ccn_btree_content_cobid(leaf, i));
00732         return(*accp == CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION);
00733     }
00734     else {
00735         content_base = r_store_content_base(h, content);
00736         if (content_base == NULL)
00737             return(-1);
00738         res = ccn_btree_prepare_for_update(h->btree, leaf);
00739         if (res < 0)
00740             return(-1);
00741         res = ccn_btree_insert_content(leaf, i,
00742                                        ccnr_accession_encode(h, content->accession),
00743                                        content_base,
00744                                        pco,
00745                                        content->flatname);
00746         if (res < 0)
00747             return(-1);
00748         if (ccn_btree_oversize(btree, leaf)) {
00749             res = ccn_btree_split(btree, leaf);
00750             for (limit = 100; res >= 0 && btree->nextsplit != 0; limit--) {
00751                 if (limit == 0) abort();
00752                 node = ccn_btree_getnode(btree, btree->nextsplit, 0);
00753                 if (node == NULL)
00754                     return(-1);
00755                 res = ccn_btree_split(btree, node);
00756             }
00757         }
00758         r_store_index_needs_cleaning(h);
00759         
00760         *accp = content->accession;
00761         return(2);
00762     }
00763 }
00764 
00765 /**
00766  *  Remove internal representation of a content object
00767  */
00768 PUBLIC void
00769 r_store_forget_content(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry **pentry)
00770 {
00771     struct content_entry *entry = *pentry;
00772     
00773     if (entry == NULL)
00774         return;
00775     *pentry = NULL;
00776     /* Remove the accession reference */
00777     /* more cleanup, including the content_by_cookie cleanup,
00778      * is done by the finalizer for the accession hash table
00779      */
00780     if (entry->accession != CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION) {
00781         struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00782         struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00783         hashtb_start(h->content_by_accession_tab, e);
00784         if (hashtb_seek(e, &entry->accession, sizeof(entry->accession), 0) ==
00785             HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
00786             ccnr_msg(h, "orphaned content %llu",
00787                      (unsigned long long)(entry->accession));
00788             hashtb_delete(e);
00789             hashtb_end(e);
00790             return;
00791         }
00792         entry->accession = CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION;
00793         hashtb_delete(e);
00794         hashtb_end(e);
00795     } else {
00796         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdf, CCNL_FINER)) {
00797               ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "removing unenrolled content", NULL, entry);
00798         }
00799         cleanup_content_entry(h, entry);
00800     }
00801 }
00802 
00803 /**
00804  *  Get a handle on the content object that matches key, or if there is
00805  * no match, the one that would come just after it.
00806  *
00807  * The key is in flatname format.
00808  */
00809 static struct content_entry *    
00810 r_store_look(struct ccnr_handle *h, const unsigned char *key, size_t size)
00811 {
00812     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00813     struct ccn_btree_node *leaf = NULL;
00814     ccnr_accession accession;
00815     int ndx;
00816     int res;
00817 
00818     res = ccn_btree_lookup(h->btree, key, size, &leaf);
00819     if (res >= 0) {
00820         ndx = CCN_BT_SRCH_INDEX(res);
00821         if (ndx == ccn_btree_node_nent(leaf)) {
00822             res = ccn_btree_next_leaf(h->btree, leaf, &leaf);
00823             if (res <= 0)
00824                 return(NULL);
00825             ndx = 0;
00826         }
00827         accession = ccnr_accession_decode(h, ccn_btree_content_cobid(leaf, ndx));
00828         if (accession != CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION) {
00829             struct content_by_accession_entry *entry;
00830             entry = hashtb_lookup(h->content_by_accession_tab,
00831                                     &accession, sizeof(accession));
00832             if (entry != NULL)
00833                 content = entry->content;
00834             if (content == NULL) {
00835                 /* Construct handle without actually reading the cob */
00836                 res = ccn_btree_content_cobsz(leaf, ndx);
00837                 content = calloc(1, sizeof(*content));
00838                 if (res > 0 && content != NULL) {
00839                     content->accession = accession;
00840                     content->cob = NULL;
00841                     content->size = res;
00842                     content->flatname = ccn_charbuf_create();
00843                     CHKPTR(content->flatname);
00844                     res = ccn_btree_key_fetch(content->flatname, leaf, ndx);
00845                     CHKRES(res);
00846                     r_store_enroll_content(h, content);
00847                 }
00848             }
00849         }
00850     }
00851     return(content);
00852 }
00853 
00854 /**
00855  * Extract the flatname representations of the bounds for the
00856  * next component after the name prefix of the interest.
00857  * These are exclusive bounds.  The results are appended to
00858  * lower and upper (when not NULL).  If there is
00859  * no lower bound, lower will be unchanged.
00860  * If there is no upper bound, a sentinel value is appended to upper.
00861  *
00862  * @returns on success the number of Components in Exclude.
00863  *          A negative value indicates an error.
00864  */
00865 static int
00866 ccn_append_interest_bounds(const unsigned char *interest_msg,
00867                            const struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi,
00868                            struct ccn_charbuf *lower,
00869                            struct ccn_charbuf *upper)
00870 {
00871     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
00872     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = NULL;
00873     size_t xstart = 0;
00874     size_t xend = 0;
00875     int atlower = 0;
00876     int atupper = 0;
00877     int res = 0;
00878     int nexcl = 0;
00879     
00880     if (pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] < pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Exclude]) {
00881         d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder,
00882                                   interest_msg + pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude],
00883                                   pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Exclude] -
00884                                   pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude]);
00885         ccn_buf_advance(d);
00886         if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Any)) {
00887             ccn_buf_advance(d);
00888             ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00889             atlower = 1; /* look for <Exclude><Any/><Component>... case */
00890         }
00891         else if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Bloom))
00892             ccn_buf_advance_past_element(d);
00893         while (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Component)) {
00894             nexcl++;
00895             xstart = pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] + d->decoder.token_index;
00896             ccn_buf_advance_past_element(d);
00897             xend = pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] + d->decoder.token_index;
00898             if (atlower && lower != NULL && d->decoder.state >= 0) {
00899                 res = ccn_flatname_append_from_ccnb(lower,
00900                         interest_msg + xstart, xend - xstart, 0, 1);
00901                 if (res < 0)
00902                     d->decoder.state = - __LINE__;
00903             }
00904             atlower = 0;
00905             atupper = 0;
00906             if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Any)) {
00907                 atupper = 1; /* look for ...</Component><Any/></Exclude> case */
00908                 ccn_buf_advance(d);
00909                 ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00910             }
00911             else if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Bloom))
00912                 ccn_buf_advance_past_element(d);
00913         }
00914         ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00915         res = d->decoder.state;
00916     }
00917     if (upper != NULL) {
00918         if (atupper && res >= 0)
00919             res = ccn_flatname_append_from_ccnb(upper,
00920                      interest_msg + xstart, xend - xstart, 0, 1);
00921         else
00922             ccn_charbuf_append(upper, "\377\377\377", 3);
00923     }
00924     return (res < 0 ? res : 0);
00925 }
00926 
00927 static struct content_entry *
00928 r_store_lookup_backwards(struct ccnr_handle *h,
00929                          const unsigned char *interest_msg,
00930                          const struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi,
00931                          struct ccn_indexbuf *comps)
00932 {
00933     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00934     struct ccn_btree_node *leaf = NULL;
00935     struct ccn_charbuf *lower = NULL;
00936     struct ccn_charbuf *f = NULL;
00937     size_t size;
00938     size_t fsz;
00939     int errline = 0;
00940     int try = 0;
00941     int ndx;
00942     int res;
00943     int rnc;
00944     
00945     size = pi->offset[CCN_PI_E];
00946     f = ccn_charbuf_create_n(pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Name]);
00947     lower = ccn_charbuf_create();
00948     if (f == NULL || lower == NULL) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; };
00949     rnc = ccn_flatname_from_ccnb(f, interest_msg, size);
00950     fsz = f->length;
00951     res = ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(lower, f);
00952     if (rnc < 0 || res < 0) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; };
00953     res = ccn_append_interest_bounds(interest_msg, pi, lower, f);
00954     if (res < 0) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; };
00955     /* Now f is beyond any we care about */
00956     res = ccn_btree_lookup(h->btree, f->buf, f->length, &leaf);
00957     if (res < 0) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; };
00958     ndx = CCN_BT_SRCH_INDEX(res);
00959     for (try = 1;; try++) {
00960         if (ndx == 0) {
00961             res = ccn_btree_prev_leaf(h->btree, leaf, &leaf);
00962             if (res != 1) goto Done;
00963             ndx = ccn_btree_node_nent(leaf);
00964             if (ndx <= 0) goto Done;
00965         }
00966         ndx -= 1;
00967         res = ccn_btree_compare(lower->buf, lower->length, leaf, ndx);
00968         if (res > 0 || (res == 0 && lower->length > fsz))
00969             goto Done;
00970         f->length = 0;
00971         res = ccn_btree_key_fetch(f, leaf, ndx);
00972         if (res < 0) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; }
00973         if (f->length > fsz) {
00974             rnc = ccn_flatname_next_comp(f->buf + fsz, f->length - fsz);
00975             if (rnc < 0) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; };
00976             f->length = fsz + CCNFLATDELIMSZ(rnc) + CCNFLATDATASZ(rnc);
00977             res = ccn_btree_lookup(h->btree, f->buf, f->length, &leaf);
00978             if (res < 0) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; };
00979             ndx = CCN_BT_SRCH_INDEX(res);
00980         }
00981         else if (f->length < fsz) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; }
00982         res = ccn_btree_match_interest(leaf, ndx, interest_msg, pi, f);
00983         if (res == 1) {
00984             res = ccn_btree_key_fetch(f, leaf, ndx);
00985             if (res < 0) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; }
00986             content = r_store_look(h, f->buf, f->length);
00987             goto Done;
00988         }
00989         else if (res != 0) { errline = __LINE__; goto Done; }
00990     }
00991 Done:
00992     if (errline != 0)
00993         ccnr_debug_ccnb(h, errline, "match_error", NULL, interest_msg, size);
00994     else {
00995         if (content != NULL) {
00996             h->count_rmc_found += 1;
00997             h->count_rmc_found_iters += try;
00998         }
00999         else {
01000             h->count_rmc_notfound += 1;
01001             h->count_rmc_notfound_iters += try;
01002         }
01003     }
01004     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&lower);
01005     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&f);
01006     return(content);
01007 }
01008 
01009 PUBLIC struct content_entry *
01010 r_store_find_first_match_candidate(struct ccnr_handle *h,
01011                                    const unsigned char *interest_msg,
01012                                    const struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi)
01013 {
01014     struct ccn_charbuf *flatname = NULL;
01015     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
01016     
01017     flatname = ccn_charbuf_create_n(pi->offset[CCN_PI_E]);
01018     ccn_flatname_from_ccnb(flatname, interest_msg, pi->offset[CCN_PI_E]);
01019     ccn_append_interest_bounds(interest_msg, pi, flatname, NULL);
01020     content = r_store_look(h, flatname->buf, flatname->length);
01021     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&flatname);
01022     return(content);
01023 }
01024 
01025 PUBLIC int
01026 r_store_content_matches_interest_prefix(struct ccnr_handle *h,
01027                                 struct content_entry *content,
01028                                 const unsigned char *interest_msg,
01029                                 size_t interest_size)
01030 {
01031     struct ccn_charbuf *flatname = ccn_charbuf_create_n(interest_size);
01032     int ans;
01033     int cmp;
01034 
01035     ccn_flatname_from_ccnb(flatname, interest_msg, interest_size);
01036     cmp = ccn_flatname_charbuf_compare(flatname, content->flatname);
01037     ans = (cmp == 0 || cmp == -9999);
01038     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&flatname);
01039     return(ans);
01040 }
01041 
01042 PUBLIC struct content_entry *
01043 r_store_content_next(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
01044 {
01045     if (content == NULL)
01046         return(0);
01047     /* We need to go past the current name, so make sure there is a 0 byte */
01048     ccn_charbuf_as_string(content->flatname);
01049     content = r_store_look(h, content->flatname->buf, content->flatname->length + 1);
01050     return(content);
01051 }
01052 
01053 PUBLIC struct content_entry *
01054 r_store_next_child_at_level(struct ccnr_handle *h,
01055                     struct content_entry *content, int level)
01056 {
01057     struct content_entry *next = NULL;
01058     struct ccn_charbuf *name;
01059     struct ccn_charbuf *flatname = NULL;
01060     int res;
01061     
01062     if (content == NULL)
01063         return(NULL);
01064     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
01065     ccn_name_init(name);
01066     res = ccn_name_append_flatname(name,
01067                                    content->flatname->buf,
01068                                    content->flatname->length, 0, level + 1);
01069     if (res < level)
01070         goto Bail;
01071     if (res == level)
01072         res = ccn_name_append(name, NULL, 0);
01073     else if (res == level + 1)
01074         res = ccn_name_next_sibling(name); // XXX - would be nice to have a flatname version of this
01075     if (res < 0)
01076         goto Bail;
01077     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_8, CCNL_FINER))
01078         ccnr_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "child_successor", NULL,
01079                         name->buf, name->length);
01080     flatname = ccn_charbuf_create();
01081     ccn_flatname_from_ccnb(flatname, name->buf, name->length);
01082     next = r_store_look(h, flatname->buf, flatname->length);
01083     if (next == content) {
01084         // XXX - I think this case should not occur, but just in case, avoid a loop.
01085         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "urp", NULL, next);
01086         next = NULL;
01087     }
01088 Bail:
01089     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
01090     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&flatname);
01091     return(next);
01092 }
01093 
01094 PUBLIC struct content_entry *
01095 r_store_lookup(struct ccnr_handle *h,
01096                const unsigned char *msg,
01097                const struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi,
01098                struct ccn_indexbuf *comps)
01099 {
01100     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
01101     struct ccn_btree_node *leaf = NULL;
01102     ccnr_cookie last_match = 0;
01103     ccnr_accession last_match_acc = CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION;
01104     struct ccn_charbuf *scratch = NULL;
01105     size_t size = pi->offset[CCN_PI_E];
01106     int ndx;
01107     int res;
01108     int try;
01109     
01110     if ((pi->orderpref & 1) == 1) {
01111         content = r_store_lookup_backwards(h, msg, pi, comps);
01112         return(content);
01113     }
01114     
01115     content = r_store_find_first_match_candidate(h, msg, pi);
01116     if (content != NULL && CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_8, CCNL_FINER))
01117         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "first_candidate", NULL,
01118                            content);
01119     if (content != NULL &&
01120         !r_store_content_matches_interest_prefix(h, content, msg, size)) {
01121             if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_8, CCNL_FINER))
01122                 ccnr_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "prefix_mismatch", NULL,
01123                                 msg, size);
01124             content = NULL;
01125         }
01126     scratch = ccn_charbuf_create();
01127     for (try = 1; content != NULL; try++) {
01128         res = ccn_btree_lookup(h->btree,
01129                                content->flatname->buf,
01130                                content->flatname->length,
01131                                &leaf);
01132         if (CCN_BT_SRCH_FOUND(res) == 0) {
01133             ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "impossible", NULL, content);
01134             content = NULL;
01135             break;
01136         }
01137         ndx = CCN_BT_SRCH_INDEX(res);
01138         res = ccn_btree_match_interest(leaf, ndx, msg, pi, scratch);
01139         if (res == -1) {
01140             ccnr_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "match_error", NULL, msg, size);
01141             content = NULL;
01142             break;
01143         }
01144         if (res == 1) {
01145             if ((pi->orderpref & 1) == 0) // XXX - should be symbolic
01146                 break;
01147             last_match = content->cookie;
01148             last_match_acc = content->accession;
01149             content = r_store_next_child_at_level(h, content, comps->n - 1);
01150         }
01151         else
01152             content = r_store_content_next(h, content);
01153         if (content != NULL &&
01154             !r_store_content_matches_interest_prefix(h, content, msg, size))
01155                 content = NULL;
01156     }
01157     if (last_match != 0) {
01158         content = r_store_content_from_cookie(h, last_match);
01159         if (content == NULL)
01160             content = r_store_content_from_accession(h, last_match_acc);
01161     }
01162     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&scratch);
01163     if (content != NULL) {
01164         h->count_lmc_found += 1;
01165         h->count_lmc_found_iters += try;
01166     }
01167     else {
01168         h->count_lmc_notfound += 1;
01169         h->count_lmc_notfound_iters += try;
01170     }
01171     return(content);
01172 }
01173 
01174 /**
01175  * Find the first content handle that matches the prefix given by the namish,
01176  * which may be a Name, Interest, ContentObject, ...
01177  *
01178  * Does not check the other parts of namish, in particular, does not generate
01179  * the digest component of a ContentObject.
01180  */
01181 PUBLIC struct content_entry *
01182 r_store_lookup_ccnb(struct ccnr_handle *h,
01183                     const unsigned char *namish, size_t size)
01184 {
01185     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
01186     struct ccn_charbuf *flatname = NULL;
01187     int res;
01188     
01189     flatname = ccn_charbuf_create();
01190     if (flatname == NULL)
01191         goto Bail;
01192     res = ccn_flatname_from_ccnb(flatname, namish, size);
01193     if (res < 0)
01194         goto Bail;
01195     content = r_store_look(h, flatname->buf, flatname->length);
01196     if (content != NULL) {
01197         res = ccn_flatname_charbuf_compare(flatname, content->flatname);
01198         if (res == 0 || res == -9999) {
01199             /* prefix matches */
01200         }
01201         else
01202             content = NULL;
01203     }
01204 Bail:
01205     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&flatname);
01206     return(content);
01207 }
01208 
01209 /**
01210  * Mark content as stale
01211  */
01212 PUBLIC void
01213 r_store_mark_stale(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
01214 {
01215     ccnr_cookie cookie = content->cookie;
01216     if ((content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE) != 0)
01217         return;
01218     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_4, CCNL_FINE))
01219             ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "stale", NULL, content);
01220     content->flags |= CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE;
01221     h->n_stale++;
01222     if (cookie < h->min_stale)
01223         h->min_stale = cookie;
01224     if (cookie > h->max_stale)
01225         h->max_stale = cookie;
01226 }
01227 
01228 /**
01229  * Scheduled event that makes content stale when its FreshnessSeconds
01230  * has expired.
01231  */
01232 static int
01233 expire_content(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
01234                void *clienth,
01235                struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
01236                int flags)
01237 {
01238     struct ccnr_handle *h = clienth;
01239     ccnr_cookie cookie = ev->evint;
01240     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
01241     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0)
01242         return(0);
01243     content = r_store_content_from_cookie(h, cookie);
01244     if (content != NULL)
01245         r_store_mark_stale(h, content);
01246     return(0);
01247 }
01248 
01249 /**
01250  * Schedules content expiration based on its FreshnessSeconds.
01251  *
01252  */
01253 PUBLIC void
01254 r_store_set_content_timer(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content,
01255                   struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco)
01256 {
01257     int seconds = 0;
01258     int microseconds = 0;
01259     size_t start = pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_FreshnessSeconds];
01260     size_t stop  = pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_FreshnessSeconds];
01261     const unsigned char *content_msg = NULL;
01262     if (start == stop)
01263         return;
01264     content_msg = r_store_content_base(h, content);
01265     if (content_msg == NULL) {
01266         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "Missing_content_base", NULL,
01267                            content);
01268         return;        
01269     }
01270     seconds = ccn_fetch_tagged_nonNegativeInteger(
01271                 CCN_DTAG_FreshnessSeconds,
01272                 content_msg,
01273                 start, stop);
01274     if (seconds <= 0)
01275         return;
01276     if (seconds > ((1U<<31) / 1000000)) {
01277         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "FreshnessSeconds_too_large", NULL,
01278                            content);
01279         return;
01280     }
01281     microseconds = seconds * 1000000;
01282     ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, microseconds,
01283                        &expire_content, NULL, content->cookie);
01284 }
01285 
01286 /**
01287  * Parses content object and sets content->flatname
01288  */
01289 static int
01290 r_store_set_flatname(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content,
01291                      struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco)
01292 {
01293     int res;
01294     struct ccn_charbuf *flatname = NULL;
01295     const unsigned char *msg = NULL;
01296     size_t size;
01297     
01298     msg = r_store_content_base(h, content);
01299     size = content->size;
01300     if (msg == NULL)
01301         goto Bail;
01302     flatname = ccn_charbuf_create();
01303     if (flatname == NULL)
01304         goto Bail;    
01305     res = ccn_parse_ContentObject(msg, size, pco, NULL);
01306     if (res < 0) {
01307         ccnr_msg(h, "error parsing ContentObject - code %d", res);
01308         goto Bail;
01309     }
01310     ccn_digest_ContentObject(msg, pco);
01311     if (pco->digest_bytes != 32)
01312         goto Bail;
01313     res = ccn_flatname_from_ccnb(flatname, msg, size);
01314     if (res < 0) goto Bail;
01315     res = ccn_flatname_append_component(flatname, pco->digest, pco->digest_bytes);
01316     if (res < 0) goto Bail;
01317     content->flatname = flatname;
01318     flatname = NULL;
01319     return(0);
01320 Bail:
01321     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&flatname);
01322     return(-1);
01323 }
01324 
01325 /**
01326  *  Get the flatname associated with content
01327  *
01328  * @returns flatname in a charbuf, which should be treated as read-only.
01329  */
01330 PUBLIC struct ccn_charbuf *
01331 r_store_content_flatname(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
01332 {
01333     return(content->flatname);
01334 }
01335 
01336 PUBLIC struct content_entry *
01337 process_incoming_content(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct fdholder *fdholder,
01338                          unsigned char *msg, size_t size, off_t *offsetp)
01339 {
01340     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject obj = {0};
01341     int res;
01342     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
01343     ccnr_accession accession = CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION;
01344     
01345     content = calloc(1, sizeof(*content));
01346     if (content == NULL)
01347         goto Bail;    
01348     content->cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
01349     if (content->cob == NULL)
01350         goto Bail;    
01351     res = ccn_charbuf_append(content->cob, msg, size);
01352     if (res < 0) goto Bail;
01353     content->size = size;
01354     res = r_store_set_flatname(h, content, &obj);
01355     if (res < 0) goto Bail;
01356     ccnr_meter_bump(h, fdholder->meter[FM_DATI], 1);
01357     content->accession = CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION;
01358     if (fdholder->filedesc == h->active_in_fd && offsetp != NULL) {
01359         // if we are reading from repoFile1 to rebuild the index we already know
01360         // the accession number
01361         content->accession = ((ccnr_accession)*offsetp) | r_store_mark_repoFile1;
01362     }
01363     r_store_enroll_content(h, content);
01364     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_4, CCNL_FINE))
01365         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "content_from", fdholder, content);
01366     res = r_store_content_btree_insert(h, content, &obj, &accession);
01367     if (res < 0) goto Bail;
01368     if (res == 0) {
01369         /* Content was there, with an accession */
01370         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_4, CCNL_FINER))
01371             ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "content_duplicate",
01372                                fdholder, content);
01373         h->content_dups_recvd++;
01374         r_store_forget_content(h, &content);
01375         content = r_store_content_from_accession(h, accession);
01376         if (content == NULL)
01377             goto Bail;
01378     }
01379     r_store_set_content_timer(h, content, &obj);
01380     r_match_match_interests(h, content, &obj, NULL, fdholder);
01381     return(content);
01382 Bail:
01383     r_store_forget_content(h, &content);
01384     return(content);
01385 }
01386 
01387 PUBLIC int
01388 r_store_content_field_access(struct ccnr_handle *h,
01389                              struct content_entry *content,
01390                              enum ccn_dtag dtag,
01391                              const unsigned char **bufp, size_t *sizep)
01392 {
01393     int res = -1;
01394     const unsigned char *content_msg;
01395     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pco = {0};
01396     
01397     content_msg = r_store_content_base(h, content);
01398     if (content_msg == NULL)
01399         return(-1);
01400     res = ccn_parse_ContentObject(content_msg, content->size, &pco, NULL);
01401     if (res < 0)
01402         return(-1);
01403     if (dtag == CCN_DTAG_Content)
01404         res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Content, content_msg,
01405                                   pco.offset[CCN_PCO_B_Content],
01406                                   pco.offset[CCN_PCO_E_Content],
01407                                   bufp, sizep);
01408     return(res);
01409 }
01410 
01411 
01412 PUBLIC int
01413 r_store_set_accession_from_offset(struct ccnr_handle *h,
01414                                   struct content_entry *content,
01415                                   struct fdholder *fdholder, off_t offset)
01416 {
01417     struct ccn_btree_node *leaf = NULL;
01418     uint_least64_t cobid;
01419     int ndx;
01420     int res = -1;
01421     
01422     if (offset != (off_t)-1 && content->accession == CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION) {
01423         struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01424         struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01425         struct content_by_accession_entry *entry = NULL;
01426         
01427         content->flags |= CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STABLE;
01428         content->accession = ((ccnr_accession)offset) | r_store_mark_repoFile1;
01429         hashtb_start(h->content_by_accession_tab, e);
01430         hashtb_seek(e, &content->accession, sizeof(content->accession), 0);
01431         entry = e->data;
01432         if (entry != NULL) {
01433             entry->content = content;
01434             if (content->cob != NULL)
01435                 h->cob_count++;
01436         }
01437         hashtb_end(e);
01438         if (content->flatname != NULL) {
01439             res = ccn_btree_lookup(h->btree,
01440                                    content->flatname->buf,
01441                                    content->flatname->length, &leaf);
01442             if (res >= 0 && CCN_BT_SRCH_FOUND(res)) {
01443                 ndx = CCN_BT_SRCH_INDEX(res);
01444                 cobid = ccnr_accession_encode(h, content->accession);
01445                 ccn_btree_prepare_for_update(h->btree, leaf);
01446                 res = ccn_btree_content_set_cobid(leaf, ndx, cobid);
01447             }
01448             else
01449                 res = -1;
01450         }
01451         if (res >= 0 && content->accession >= h->notify_after) 
01452             r_sync_notify_content(h, 0, content);
01453     }
01454     return(res);
01455 }
01456 
01457 PUBLIC void
01458 r_store_send_content(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct fdholder *fdholder, struct content_entry *content)
01459 {
01460     const unsigned char *content_msg = NULL;
01461     off_t offset;
01462 
01463     content_msg = r_store_content_base(h, content);
01464     if (content_msg == NULL) {
01465         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "content_missing", fdholder, content);
01466         return;        
01467     }
01468     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_4, CCNL_FINE))
01469         ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "content_to", fdholder, content);
01470     r_link_stuff_and_send(h, fdholder, content_msg, content->size, NULL, 0, &offset);
01471     if (offset != (off_t)-1 && content->accession == CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION) {
01472         int res;
01473         res = r_store_set_accession_from_offset(h, content, fdholder, offset);
01474         if (res == 0)
01475             if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_4, CCNL_FINE))
01476                 ccnr_debug_content(h, __LINE__, "content_stored",
01477                                    r_io_fdholder_from_fd(h, h->active_out_fd),
01478                                    content);
01479     }
01480 }
01481 
01482 PUBLIC int
01483 r_store_commit_content(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
01484 {
01485     struct fdholder *fdholder = r_io_fdholder_from_fd(h, h->active_out_fd);
01486     // XXX - here we need to check if this is something we *should* be storing, according to our policy
01487     if ((r_store_content_flags(content) & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STABLE) == 0) {
01488         if (fdholder == NULL)
01489         {
01490             ccnr_msg(h, "Repository shutting down due to error storing content.");
01491             h->running = 0;
01492             return(-1);
01493         }
01494         r_store_send_content(h, r_io_fdholder_from_fd(h, h->active_out_fd), content);
01495         r_store_content_change_flags(content, CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STABLE, 0);
01496     }
01497     return(0);
01498 }
01499 
01500 PUBLIC void
01501 ccnr_debug_content(struct ccnr_handle *h,
01502                    int lineno,
01503                    const char *msg,
01504                    struct fdholder *fdholder,
01505                    struct content_entry *content)
01506 {
01507     struct ccn_charbuf *c = ccn_charbuf_create();
01508     struct ccn_charbuf *flat = content->flatname;
01509     
01510     if (c == NULL)
01511         return;
01512     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "debug.%d %s ", lineno, msg);
01513     if (fdholder != NULL)
01514         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "%u ", fdholder->filedesc);
01515     if (flat != NULL)
01516         ccn_uri_append_flatname(c, flat->buf, flat->length, 1);
01517     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, " (%d bytes)", content->size);
01518     ccnr_msg(h, "%s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(c));
01519     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
01520 }
01521 
01522 /** Number of btree index writes to do in a batch */
01523 #define CCN_BT_CLEAN_BATCH 3
01524 /** Approximate delay between batches of btree index writes */
01525 #define CCN_BT_CLEAN_TICK_MICROS 65536
01526 static int
01527 r_store_index_cleaner(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
01528     void *clienth,
01529     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
01530     int flags)
01531 {
01532     struct ccnr_handle *h = clienth;
01533     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01534     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01535     struct ccn_btree_node *node = NULL;
01536     int k;
01537     int res;
01538     int overquota;
01539     
01540     (void)(sched);
01541     (void)(ev);
01542     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0 ||
01543          h->btree == NULL || h->btree->io == NULL) {
01544         h->index_cleaner = NULL;
01545         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->toclean);
01546         return(0);
01547     }
01548     /* First, work on cleaning the things we already know need cleaning */
01549     if (h->toclean != NULL) {
01550         for (k = 0; k < CCN_BT_CLEAN_BATCH && h->toclean->n > 0; k++) {
01551             node = ccn_btree_rnode(h->btree, h->toclean->buf[--h->toclean->n]);
01552             if (node != NULL && node->iodata != NULL) {
01553                 res = ccn_btree_chknode(node); /* paranoia */
01554                 if (res < 0 || CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdfsdffd, CCNL_FINER))
01555                     ccnr_msg(h, "write index node %u (err %d)",
01556                              (unsigned)node->nodeid, node->corrupt);
01557                 if (res >= 0) {
01558                     if (node->clean != node->buf->length)
01559                         res = h->btree->io->btwrite(h->btree->io, node);
01560                     if (res < 0)
01561                         ccnr_msg(h, "failed to write index node %u",
01562                                  (unsigned)node->nodeid);
01563                     else
01564                         node->clean = node->buf->length;
01565                 }
01566                 if (res >= 0 && node->iodata != NULL && node->activity == 0) {
01567                     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdfsdffd, CCNL_FINER))
01568                         ccnr_msg(h, "close index node %u",
01569                                  (unsigned)node->nodeid);
01570                     res = ccn_btree_close_node(h->btree, node);
01571                 }
01572             }
01573         }
01574         if (h->toclean->n > 0)
01575             return(nrand48(h->seed) % (2U * CCN_BT_CLEAN_TICK_MICROS) + 500);
01576     }
01577     /* Sweep though and find the nodes that still need cleaning */
01578     overquota = 0;
01579     if (h->btree->nodepool >= 16)
01580         overquota = hashtb_n(h->btree->resident) - h->btree->nodepool;
01581     hashtb_start(h->btree->resident, e);
01582     for (node = e->data; node != NULL; node = e->data) {
01583         if (overquota > 0 &&
01584               node->activity == 0 &&
01585               node->iodata == NULL &&
01586               node->clean == node->buf->length) {
01587             overquota -= 1;
01588             if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdfsdffd, CCNL_FINEST))
01589                 ccnr_msg(h, "prune index node %u",
01590                          (unsigned)node->nodeid);
01591             hashtb_delete(e);
01592             continue;
01593         }
01594         node->activity /= 2; /* Age the node's activity */
01595         if (node->clean != node->buf->length ||
01596             (node->iodata != NULL && node->activity == 0)) {
01597             if (h->toclean == NULL) {
01598                 h->toclean = ccn_indexbuf_create();
01599                 if (h->toclean == NULL)
01600                     break;
01601             }
01602             ccn_indexbuf_append_element(h->toclean, node->nodeid);
01603         }
01604         hashtb_next(e);
01605     }
01606     hashtb_end(e);
01607     /* If nothing to do, shut down cleaner */
01608     if ((h->toclean == NULL || h->toclean->n == 0) && overquota <= 0 &&
01609         h->btree->io->openfds <= CCN_BT_OPEN_NODES_IDLE) {
01610         h->btree->cleanreq = 0;
01611         h->index_cleaner = NULL;
01612         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->toclean);
01613         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdfsdffd, CCNL_FINE))
01614             ccnr_msg(h, "index btree nodes all clean");
01615         
01616         return(0);
01617     }
01618     return(nrand48(h->seed) % (2U * CCN_BT_CLEAN_TICK_MICROS) + 500);
01619 }
01620 
01621 PUBLIC void
01622 r_store_index_needs_cleaning(struct ccnr_handle *h)
01623 {
01624     int k;
01625     if (h->btree != NULL && h->btree->io != NULL && h->btree->cleanreq > 0) {
01626         if (h->index_cleaner == NULL) {
01627             h->index_cleaner = ccn_schedule_event(h->sched,
01628                                                   CCN_BT_CLEAN_TICK_MICROS,
01629                                                   r_store_index_cleaner, NULL, 0);
01630             if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdfsdffd, CCNL_FINER))
01631                 ccnr_msg(h, "index cleaner started");
01632         }
01633         /* If necessary, clean in a hurry. */
01634         for (k = 30; /* Backstop to make sure we do not loop here */
01635              k > 0 && h->index_cleaner != NULL &&
01636              h->btree->io->openfds > CCN_BT_OPEN_NODES_LIMIT - 2; k--)
01637             r_store_index_cleaner(h->sched, h, h->index_cleaner, 0);
01638         if (k == 0)
01639             ccnr_msg(h, "index cleaner is in trouble");
01640     }
01641 }
